oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Regio- and chemoselective reduction of aromatic nitro and carbonyl compounds over novel Baker's yeast immobilized nanoporous silicates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MOHAPATRA, SK
SELVAM, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: molecular-sieves
selective reduction
stereochemical control
microbial reduction
keto-esters
azo
nitroarenes
mcm-41
well
baker's yeast
mesoporous
heterogeneous catalysis
selective reduction
nitroarenes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For the first time, Baker's yeast immobilized niesoporous MCM-41 (BY/MCM-41) is put forward as a promising heterogeneous catalyst for selective reduction of aromatic nitro and carbonyl containing compounds. The catalyst is highly efficient for the reduction of aromatic nitro and carbonyl groups to their respective amines and alcohols. It showed highly regio- and chemoselectivity for the reduction of substituted aromatic dinitro compounds and nitro compounds with carbonyl groups. The catalyst also showed promise for the chemoselective reduction of alpha,beta-unsaturated carbonyls to allylic alcohols. In all the cases, good to excellent yield is obtained with minimal reaction time. It is also proved that the catalyst can be reused for these purposes.
